title: AI Chatbot API - Valid Message Submission
description: Verify that the AI chatbot API processes valid messages correctly and returns contextually accurate responses with timestamps.

steps.description: Send a valid POST request to /bot/v1/message with a text message, valid location object, and an optional conversation history array.
Receive HTTP 200 response with JSON containing a non-empty AI-generated response string and a valid ISO 8601 timestamp.
Verify that the response message contextually relates to the submitted disaster management query.

title: AI Chatbot API - Missing Required Text Parameter
description: Ensure that the chatbot API properly handles requests missing the required 'text' field with appropriate error messaging and status code.

steps.description: Send a POST request to /bot/v1/message with an empty payload or payload missing the 'text' property.
Receive HTTP 400 Bad Request status with an error message specifying the missing 'text' parameter.

title: Frontend Interface - Real-Time Emergency Data Display
description: Verify that the frontend dashboard correctly renders real-time emergency alerts, contacts, and checklists responsive to data updates.

steps.description: Load the main disaster management frontend page.
Confirm emergency alerts, contacts, and checklist UI elements are visible and populated.
Simulate incoming update event with changed emergency data.
Verify the frontend interface updates data displays dynamically and maintains correct responsiveness.

title: Chatbot Popup Interface - Send and Receive Messages
description: Ensure that the standalone chatbot popup allows users to send queries, handles backend responses, and displays conversation history properly.

steps.description: Open chatbot popup interface.
Enter a valid disaster-related query in the input field and submit.
Confirm the message is sent to the backend and the AI-generated response appears in chat with correct timestamp.
Scroll the chat history up and down.
Verify that historical messages are retained and displayed consistently in order.

title: Offline Fallback - Mock API Responses when Backend Unreachable
description: Validate that when the backend API is unavailable, the client-side mock API fallback activates automatically and returns intelligent disaster management responses.

steps.description: Simulate backend /bot/v1/message endpoint downtime by disabling API.
Send messages via chatbot interface.
Verify that mock-api.js triggers offline mode and receives mock responses within expected context.
Ensure that mock responses are sensible, contextually relevant, and formatted like live backend responses.

title: MongoDB User and Bot Message History Storage
description: Test that user and bot messages are stored in MongoDB with accurate timestamps and data integrity and can be retrieved properly.

steps.description: Send a chat message to the AI chatbot API.
Check MongoDB user and bot message collections for the inserted records.
Verify each message record has properly formatted timestamp, correct sender role, and message content matches sent/received text.
Retrieve chat history from the database via API or frontend call.
Confirm that the returned history matches stored data and maintains correct order.

title: Environment Configuration - Auto Endpoint Switching
description: Validate that the frontend automatically switches API endpoints correctly between development (localhost) and production environments.

steps.description: Run the frontend locally with localhost in URL.
Confirm that API calls point to development backend endpoints.
Deploy frontend in production environment URL.
Verify API calls target production backend endpoints.

title: Accessibility Features - Voice Activation and Screen Reader Compatibility
description: Verify voice activation features perform commands as expected and that screen reader support correctly announces dynamic updates and interactive elements.

steps.description: Enable voice activation on the interface.
Speak common disaster-related commands or queries.
Confirm system recognizes and processes voice commands accurately.
Enable a screen reader and navigate to emergency checklist and chatbot interface.
Verify that all interactive elements and dynamic chatbot responses are properly announced and accessible.

title: Multilingual Support - Translation and Emergency Phrases
description: Ensure the platform correctly translates UI and emergency phrases into supported languages and that translation accuracy meets requirements.

steps.description: Select different supported languages on the frontend interface.
Verify UI text, chatbot responses, and emergency phrases update accordingly.
Send a message requesting common emergency phrases in a chosen language.
Check chatbot response phrases are translated correctly.

title: Simulation Mode - Emergency Preparedness Drill Functionality
description: Test the simulation mode that runs emergency scenario drills, validating scenario accuracy, timer functionality, and user guidance flows.

steps.description: Activate simulation mode from the interface.
Verify drill scenarios load correctly with appropriate instructions and timers.
Interact with drill steps and follow prompts.
Confirm responses update appropriately and final drill completion status is accurately reflected.

title: AI Hazard Prediction and AR Navigation Features
description: Validate the AI-powered hazard prediction and AR navigation overlays display correct hazard data and map navigation aids based on live aerial/satellite data.

steps.description: Enable hazard prediction feature and AR navigation.
Verify hazard risk areas and predicted events are shown on map overlays.
Use AR navigation to locate emergency resources.
Confirm navigation routes and landmarks update responsively with realistic aerial/satellite data.

title: Deployment Guide Validation - Backend and Frontend Quick Start
description: Ensure that deployment documentation and scripts enable rapid and error-free deployment on Railway, Render, and Netlify platforms.

steps.description: Follow deployment guides to deploy backend on Railway or Render.
Backend service starts without errors and exposes required API endpoints.
Deploy frontend on Netlify using provided instructions.
Frontend loads correctly, automatically configures environment, and connects to backend.
